body:
### Describe the bug

When using `# cython: np_pythran=True`, I get a compilation error "cannot find -lscipy-openblas: No such file or directory". If we use pythran instead to compile (`ext_modules=[PythranExtension...` in setup.py), the error is no longer present.

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

spam.pyx
```cython
# cython: np_pythran=True
# cython: language_level=3
cimport cython

cdef cython.integral add1(cython.integral x):
    return x + 1

```

setup.py
```python3
import numpy
import pythran
from Cython.Build import cythonize
from setuptools import setup

setup(
    ext_modules=cythonize("spam.pyx"),
    include_dirs=[numpy.get_include(), pythran.get_include()],
)
```

and `python setup.py build_ext --inplace`.

If we use this setup.py file instead: 

```python3
from pythran.dist import PythranExtension
from setuptools import setup

setup(
    ext_modules=[PythranExtension("spam", ["spam.pyx"])],
)
```

then everything works as expected.



### Expected behaviour

It seems like the command to compile using the cython setup.py is:

```
g++ -shared -L/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib -Wl,-rpath,/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib -L/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib -Wl,-rpath,/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-312/spam.o -L/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib -lscipy-openblas -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-312/spam.cpython-312-x86_64-linux-gnu.so -fvisibility=hidden -Wl,-strip-all
```

and the one with pythran:

```
g++ -shared -L/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib -Wl,-rpath,/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib -L/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib -Wl,-rpath,/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-312/spam.o -L/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-312/spam.cpython-312-x86_64-linux-gnu.so -fvisibility=hidden -Wl,-strip-all
```

i.e. only `-scipy-openblas` is added with cython.

### OS

Linux

### Python version

3.12.4

### Cython version

3.0.10

### Additional context

The full command line:

```shell

gcc -fno-strict-overflow -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -O3 -Wall -fPIC -DENABLE_PYTHON_MODULE -D__PYTHRAN__=3 -I/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pythran -I/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib/python3.12/site-packages/numpy/_core/include -I/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib/python3.12/site-packages/numpy/_core/include -I/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pythran -I/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/include/python3.12 -c spam.cpp -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-312/spam.o -std=c++11 -fno-math-errno -fno-wrapv -Wno-unused-function -Wno-int-in-bool-context -Wno-unknown-warning-option
In file included from /home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib/python3.12/site-packages/numpy/_core/include/numpy/ndarraytypes.h:1909,
                 from /home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib/python3.12/site-packages/numpy/_core/include/numpy/ndarrayobject.h:12,
                 from /home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib/python3.12/site-packages/numpy/_core/include/numpy/arrayobject.h:5,

                 from spam.cpp:1278:
/home/arnaud-ma/.pyenv/versions/3.12.4/lib/python3.12/site-packages/numpy/_core/include/numpy/npy_1_7_deprecated_api.h:17:2: warning: #warning "Using deprecated NumPy API, disable it with " "#define NPY_NO_DEPRECATED_API NPY_1_7_API_VERSION" [-Wcpp]
```
